intro: Stachytarpheta crassifolia subsp. abairensis, commonly known as the Abarénsis shrub, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its aromatic, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of tubular, violet-blue flowers. The plant belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Its botanical features include hairy stems and small, opposite leaves that contribute to its distinctive appearance.
